snippet: Despite the breathtaking wealth and vibrant culture in its metropolises, Russia remains a country where discrimination and violence against gay people are widely tolerated.
abstract: Plight of Russian homosexuals, who suffer open discrimination and regular violence, has become subject of international furor in months since Pres Vladimir V Putin signed law censoring public discussion of homosexuality; widespread condemnation presents particular difficulties for Russian officials as they prepare for 2014 Winter Olympic Games in Sochi.
lead_paragraph: Despite the breathtaking wealth and vibrant culture in its metropolises, Russia remains a country where discrimination and violence against gay people are widely tolerated.

headline.main: Gays in Russia Find No Haven, Despite Support From the West
headline.print_headline: Gays in Russia Find No Haven, Despite Support From the West

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
